author: Arsene Lupin III
subject: British Lupin
body:
> Goodbye Lady Liberty is dubbed in the UK using the
> same cast as Mystery of
> Mamo (called Secret of Mamo in UK).

Whoa, don't confuse the poor people here.
We ahould note that "Mystery of Mamo" had 2 English
dubs. One was by Streamline Pictures (Lupin was named
"Lupin III."), and a British one from Manga UK (Lupin
was named "Wolf III"). So you're basically saying that
it uses the same voice cast as the UK dub of "Secret
of Mamo". An interesting note: the UK dub's cast
imitated American accents. The reason they re-dubbed
it was likely the "Lupin name" legal issue.

> Both are rated
> as 12 here and, in my
> opinion, are excellent releases.  It is true that
> some anime films are
> poorly dubbed with extra swear words not found in
> the original Japanese
> version.  A good example of this is Cyber City Oedo
> 808, which is completely
> different from the Japanese version.

cough, cough--Manga's Cagliostro re-dub--cough, cough

> The Lupin
> films are probably the best
> dubs available.

By the way, the UK release of Cagliostro- was it an
original UK dub or was it simply a PAL version of
Streamline Pictures's dub from 1992?
